children.value: Node Combo is a new feature for V3.5. The
will be deprecated. We recommend to use Combo for node grouping.
The built-in Combos in G6 include circle and rect types.

In this document, we will briefly introduce the built-in Combos in G6, the common property, and the way to configure the combo type. To know more about each type of built-in combos in G6, please refer to the corresponding documents in this directory.
when instantiating the graph, which will result in rendering result with reasonable visual zIndex for combos.
To keep the stability of the structure of the source data, we do some compatible changes to introduce combos:
array to contains all the combos data, and each of them has the properties:
The uinique ID for the combo.
The ID of the parent combo
The label text of the combo
The style configuration of the combo, details are in
and documents of each type of combo
The label configuration of the combo, details are in
and documents of each type of combo
An example for the data item for a combo
in data items of nodes to indicate the affiliation.
The table below shows the built-in Combos and their special properties:
is a number representing the diameter
- The circle is centered at the combo position
- The label is placed on the top of the circle by default
- The rect in centered at the combo position
- The label is placed on the left top of the circle by default
The shape type of the Combo. It can be the type of built-in Combo, or the custom Combo.
The ID of the parent Combo
The minimum size of the combo. The default value for 'circle' type Combo is 20, [20, 5] for 'rect' type
The padding of the Combo. The default value for 'circle' type Combo is 25, [25, 20, 15, 20] for 'rect'
The label text of the combo
is an object to configure the filling color, stroke color, shadow, and so on. Here is the commonly used properties in
The line width of the stroke
The x offset of the shadow
The y offset of the shadow
The alpha or transparency of the combo
The filling alpha or transparency of the combo
The type of the mouse when hovering the combo. The options are the same as
// Set groupByTypes to false to get rendering result with reasonable visual zIndex for combos
is a string which indicates the content of the label.
is an object to configure the label. The commonly used configurations of
The relative positions to the combo. Options:
The label's offset along the x-axis
The label's offset along the y-axis
The style property of the label

The stroke color of the label
The line width of the label
The font size of the label

The following code shows how to configure
// Set groupByTypes to false to get rendering result with reasonable visual zIndex for combos
There are three methods to configure combos: Configure combos globally when instantiating a Graph; Configure combos in their data; Configure combos by
That means, if there are same configurations in different ways, the way with higher priority will take effect.

properties.ariaLabel: configure globally when instantiating graph permalink

children.value: to configure all the combos globally:
// Set groupByTypes to false to get rendering result with reasonable visual zIndex for combos
// Other properties for all the combos
To configure different combos with different properties, you can write the properties into their data individually:
// Style properties for this combo. Different styles for different types of combos can be refered to the subdocuments
// Style properties for this combo. Different styles for different types of combos can be refered to the subdocuments
By this way, we can configure different combos with different properties.
. It does not take effect otherwise;
It has the highest priority that will rewrite the same properties configured by other ways;
Each combo will be updated when adding or updating items. It will cost a lot when the amount of the data is large.
To allow the users to interact with the combos, we implemented three built-in behaviors:
behavior supports dragging a combo to re-arrange its position or its hierarchy.

behavior supports collapsing or expanding the combo by double clicking. The children will be hidden when the combo is collapsed, and the edges related to the children will link to the combo. If the graph has layout configuration and the
by default), this behavior will trigger re-layout. If you do not want re-layout the graph after collapsing or expanding a combo, assign
for this behavior, or use combo's click listener and
behavior allows end users to drag the node to re-arrange the position and change the hierarchy of the node and its parent combo.
The code below shows how to configure the behaviors onto the graph:
// Set groupByTypes to false to get rendering result with reasonable visual zIndex for combos
// Set groupByTypes to false to get rendering result with reasonable visual zIndex for combos
